alert.note: Alert for Jay (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS NorthernIndiana (Northern Indiana and Northeastern Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 16 at 10:39AM EST until February 18 at 10:11PM EST by NWS NorthernIndiana
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Northern Indiana has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana...Ohio... Salamonie River at Portland affecting Jay County. Eel River at North Manchester affecting Cass IN, Miami, Wabash, Whitley and Kosciusko Counties. Tiffin River at Stryker affecting Fulton OH, Williams and Defiance Counties. .The combination of snowmelt and up to 2 inches of rainfall will result in rapid rises on the river. In addition, this rise could also shift ice in the river that could lead to ice jams. This forecast is based on unobstructed flow and does not factor additional rises associated with ice jams. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE FRIDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Salamonie River at Portland. * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to late Friday evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, low spots along the walking trails, including the picnic pavilion, at the Hudson Family Park flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 2.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 11.9 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow evening. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Detailed river forecasts and additional information can be found at www.weather.gov/iwx under Rivers and Lakes. This statement will be updated within the next 12 to 24 hours.
